lists.title: FOURTH WING
lists.author: Rebecca Yarros
lists.description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

lists.title: ASSISTANT TO THE VILLAIN
lists.author: Hannah Nicole Maehrer
lists.description: Evie Sage gets a job doing unspecified office duties for the most infamous villain in the kingdom of Rennedawn.

lists.title: TOM LAKE
lists.author: Ann Patchett
lists.description: Three daughters, who return to their family orchard in the spring of 2020, learn about their mother's relationship with a famous actor.

lists.title: THE COWORKER
lists.author: Freida McFadden
lists.description: After an accountant is murdered, a sales rep at a nutritional supplement company gets caught in a game of cat and mouse.

lists.title: THE BREAKAWAY
lists.author: Jennifer Weiner
lists.description: As her wedding to a man she met at a childhood weight-loss camp approaches, Abby goes on a cycling trip to Niagara Falls in a group that includes an old fling.

lists.title: THE HOUSEMAID
lists.author: Freida McFadden
lists.description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

lists.title: TOO LATE
lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: Dangers develop when a drug trafficker becomes obsessed with a woman who has a mutual attraction to a D.E.A. agent.

lists.title: THE GIRL IN THE EAGLE'S TALONS
lists.author: Karin Smirnoff
lists.description: The seventh book in the Girl With the Dragon Tattoo series. When violence disrupts Mikael Blomkvist's daughter's marriage, Lisbeth Salander appears to be his last hope.

lists.title: IT ENDS WITH US
lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

lists.title: LESSONS IN CHEMISTRY
lists.author: Bonnie Garmus
lists.description: A scientist and single mother living in California in the 1960s becomes a star on a TV cooking show.

lists.title: THE COVENANT OF WATER
lists.author: Abraham Verghese
lists.description: Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning.

lists.title: DEMON COPPERHEAD
lists.author: Barbara Kingsolver
lists.description: Winner of a 2023 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. A reimagining of Charles Dickens’s “David Copperfield” set in the mountains of southern Appalachia.

lists.title: THE HEAVEN & EARTH GROCERY STORE
lists.author: James McBride
lists.description: Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well.

lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: Lowen Ashleigh is hired by the husband of an injured writer to complete her popular series and uncovers a horrifying truth.

lists.title: IT STARTS WITH US
lists.author: Colleen Hoover
lists.description: In the sequel to “It Ends With Us,” Lily deals with her jealous ex-husband as she reconnects with her first boyfriend.

lists.title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON
lists.author: David Grann
lists.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil.

lists.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
lists.author: Bessel van der Kolk
lists.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

lists.title: OUTLIVE
lists.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
lists.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
lists.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

lists.title: AMERICAN PROMETHEUS
lists.author: Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin
lists.contributor: by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin
lists.description: A biography of J. Robert Oppenheimer. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize in 2006 and an inspiration for the film “Oppenheimer.”

lists.title: THE WAGER
lists.author: David Grann
lists.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.

lists.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED
lists.author: Jennette McCurdy
lists.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.

lists.title: GAMBLER

lists.contributor: by Billy Walters with Armen Keteyian
lists.description: The sports gambler shares his life story and gives insights on his betting system.

lists.description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning science writer explains the sensory perceptions and ways of communication used by a variety of animals.

lists.title: CRYING IN H MART
lists.author: Michelle Zauner
lists.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

lists.contributor: by Robert F. Kennedy and Brian Hooker
lists.description: The author of “The Real Anthony Fauci” gives his analysis on vaccinated and unvaccinated populations.

lists.author: James Patterson and Duane Swierczynski
lists.contributor: by James Patterson and Duane Swierczynski
lists.description: The Eagles’ starting quarterback is murdered and his wife, a Grammy-winning singer, is the prime suspect.

lists.author: Gabrielle Zevin
lists.description: Two friends find their partnership challenged in the world of video game design.

lists.description: The father and husband of a biracial Korean American family in Virginia goes missing.

lists.title: HAPPY PLACE
lists.author: Emily Henry
lists.description: A former couple pretend to be together for the sake of their friends during their annual getaway in Maine.

lists.title: MASTERS OF DEATH
lists.author: Olivie Blake
lists.description: A real estate agent who also is a vampire seeks the help of a medium to extricate the ghost who is haunting the house she needs to sell.

lists.title: REMARKABLY BRIGHT CREATURES
lists.author: Shel Van Pelt
lists.description: A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.

lists.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
lists.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

lists.contributor: by Billy Walters with Armen Keteyian
lists.description: The sports gambler shares his life story and gives insights on his betting system.

lists.title: POVERTY, BY AMERICA
lists.author: Matthew Desmond
lists.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning author of “Evicted” examines the ways in which affluent Americans keep poor people poor.

lists.title: NEVER ENOUGH
lists.author: Jennifer Breheny Wallace
lists.description: The journalist and social commentator looks at how the pressure to succeed affects parents, educators, and children.

lists.title: THE IN-BETWEEN
lists.author: Hadley Vlahos
lists.description: A hospice nurse shares some of her most impactful experiences and questions some of society's beliefs around end-of-life care.

lists.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?
lists.author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
lists.contributor: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
lists.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it.

lists.title: BEYOND THE STORY
lists.author: BTS and Myeongseok Kang
lists.description: An oral history of the K-pop group that is celebrating its 10th anniversary.

lists.title: ADVERSITY FOR SALE
lists.author: Jay "Jeezy" Jenkins with Benjamin Meadows-Ingram
lists.contributor: by Jay "Jeezy" Jenkins with Benjamin Meadows-Ingram
lists.description: The Grammy-nominated recording artist shares how he overcame obstacles in his life and career.

lists.author: Robert F. Kennedy and Brian Hooker
lists.contributor: by Robert F. Kennedy and Brian Hooker
lists.description: The author of “The Real Anthony Fauci” gives his analysis on vaccinated and unvaccinated populations.

lists.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.

lists.title: THE FOURTH TURNING IS HERE
lists.author: Neil Howe
lists.description: One of the authors of “The Fourth Turning” gives reflections on the cycles of history and makes predictions of potential outcomes generated by the present era of polarization.

lists.author: Elliot Page
lists.description: The Oscar-nominated star details discovering himself as a trans person and navigating abuse in Hollywood.

lists.author: Chadwick Moore
lists.description: An overview of the personal and professional life of the conservative commentator Tucker Carlson.

lists.description: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.

lists.author: Hanya Yanagihara
lists.description: Four college friends, one with a traumatic past, move to New York seeking fame and fortune.

lists.title: TWISTED LOVE
lists.author: Ana Huang
lists.description: The first book in the Twisted series. Secrets emerge when Ava explores things with her brother's best friend.

lists.title: DREAMLAND

lists.description: Musicians from different backgrounds are attracted to each other, and a mother flees with her son from an abusive husband.

lists.title: BABEL

lists.title: THE SILENT PATIENT

lists.description: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.

lists.title: RED, WHITE AND ROYAL BLUE

lists.description: A staged friendship between the son of the president and his rival, the Prince of Wales, evolves into a secret and potentially dangerous romance.

lists.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
lists.author: Bessel van der Kolk
lists.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

lists.title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON
lists.author: David Grann
lists.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.

lists.contributor: by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin

lists.description: The author recalls how she and her siblings were constantly moved from one bleak place to another.

lists.description: When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.

lists.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.

lists.author: Rebecca Skloot
lists.description: The story of a woman whose cancer cells were cultured without her permission in 1951.
